title: Boundary effect - mass density if pulse inverts

content.question: Two different strings, String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, are attached to each other and pulled taut by two students, as shown in the figure. The students send a single wave pulse along String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. When the pulse reaches the boundary between String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, the wave pulse is both reflected and transmitted. The pulse that reflects back through String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is inverted and the pulse that is transmitted into String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is not. Which of the following claims about the strings is correct?

choices.label: The tension is greater in String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> than in String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

The tension is greater in String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> than in String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

The mass per length is greater for String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> than for String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

The mass per length is greater for String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> than for String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

content.answer: The mass per length is greater for String <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> than for String <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.
